1405044269458133003.title: Tell DE to Cool Their Jets
1405044269458133003.description:
Require DE to stop or significantly reduce new events for the administration until current events are drawn to a conclusion. 

For the past week, DE has started new event after new event, which is spreading the administration thin. This is a mock government, not the actual U.S. government. Let the administration and other entities some room to do something before giving them 3 other catastrophes.

Members of DE have not listened to previous plights, and so this petition is to ask the Admins to step in and tell DE to cool their jets.

1408335340363841626.title: Implement Retention Elections for all Administrators
1408335340363841626.description:
Ever since I first came to VC, there was always an argument surrounding admin accountability. Some have maintained that recall petitions are perfectly fine, some have pushed for elected administrators, and some have called for retention elections. 

Throughout the years, VC has had a fair share of Administrators who have been either hostile towards the community's interests, or simply neglected their duties. Which has allowed for a multitude of different recall elections. However, like the last couple of recalls, whenever a petition is gathering signatures, there is a flood of "I'll do better" posts on twitter. Insults are thrown, feelings get hurt, and tensions are high. Recall elections have a proclivity for devolving into a toxic mess. This is leading to Admins who really shouldn't be on the team continuing their tenure (no I'm not talking about anyone in particular). On the flip side, elected Admins becomes less about competence and more about popularity. Especially when whipping is involved (and it can happen). There are people who may be popular with the server membership who have no business trying to lead it.

So, like in times past, I believe that it is prudent for the community to have a regular Missouri-style retention election system. While the power of appointment stays with the Administration team, the server itself gets its say as to whether Admin is a good fit. As we face yet another potential devolution into inactivity, we need an Admin team who has the confidence of the server to lead it. While this system is not perfect (and recall elections are still an option), it is leagues better than the status-quo.

Therefore, We the Undersigned demand that a retention election system be implemented by the Administration. This system would call for a retention vote at regular intervals (say 120 days). This would not apply to Admins who have been appointed within a certain time (say 90 days).

Thank you.

1412129174126067735.title: N-Word Petition
1412129174126067735.description: Allow for non-hateful and casual use of the N-word. *tips hat* Yes, m’lady, that N-word. It has become just a casual part everyday vernacular. It is just as essential to the cultural zeitgeist as cereal is to milk. It is known from coast to coast like butter and toast. Black people have reclaimed the N-word, I am kindly asking the admins to let us use it on this server. RUTHKANDA forever !

Either action being taken would satisfy this petition.

1415191405973733467.title: Word Meaning Stingy
1415191405973733467.description: Petition to allow usage of the word meaning stingy, I think you know which one I mean

1415537401891127336.title: Overturn Admin Proposal 830c
1415537401891127336.description:
Reposting from what I said in Twitter channel:

"Similarily, I find that the recent proposal that mods can be removed with substantial reason to be worrisome because this means mods can just be removed and admin don't have to give a reason for it, meaning that if one of us are removed from our post and ask why, admin can simply say "we don't have to tell you". That is utter BS. This is not a corporate job where you can be fired without cause. This is a voluntary position that we have signed up for to do in our spare time, so the least the admin can do is show respect to those who did volunteer their time and, if they have to be removed, explain why."

1416059828924846260.title: Emperios second custom role

1417323156682571796.title: Conduct a recall/retention vote on every individual admin.
1417323156682571796.description:
The server has been having a great deal of problems over the past year. Activity has been dipping considerably, and attempts by players to engage with the simulation have gradually become rarer and rarer, as DE and IR slump into inactivity, the Press Orgs barely publish more than twice a month, and the Admins combat institutional problems with systemic neglect. For fear of controversy or instability or out of plain inability to create and implement effective solutions, the Admin team has been failing the community and must undergo a serious change.

I do not believe that every admin needs to be removed, and I consider them all to be benefits to the community of Virtual Congress. However, the situation is becoming more and more dire. Fatalists who quote past prophecies of VC's doom as evidence for its eternal life are making the problem worse, and as the Admins do nothing, the staff and FEC continue to fall into consolidating decay and unpopularity. 

To make the Admins actually use their extensive powers to improve the server, even at risk of controversy, the only option is either to recall the inactives or whip them into shape with the threat of recall.  And that is why I believe we should hold recall/retention elections on every member of the Admin team.

1425591031889395795.description:
Axel has attempted to circumvent proper procedure when it comes to alt accounts used to interact with the elections (ieg, buying and spending political capital). Axel approved another RNC Treasury alt that was not approved by the FEC, Axel did this in a clear conflict of interest, and it is not their call when it comes to how Alts interact with Elections - that is the primary authority of the FEC and always requires FEC authorization.

Axel did something that no regular player of the server can do: approve something, in an attempt to clearly game the system.

This makes Axel untennable as admin, especially as they continue to argue semantics with the FEC Chair.
